alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland Indian River; Inland Southern Brevard; Inland St. Lucie; Mainland Southern Brevard; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 10:34AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern St. Lucie, Indian River and southeastern Brevard Counties through 1115 AM EDT... At 1034 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles east of Melbourne Beach to near Sebastian Inlet to near South Beach. Movement was northwest at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Palm Bay, Melbourne, Rockledge, Sebastian and Vero Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
